messages.message: Sorry for reviving this month old conversation, but Arondor just raised a concern regarding https://docs.instabase.com/overview/glossary#deployments integration function mentioned separately in the deployments section, while it being part of both upstream and downstream integration(another name of custom function). Not sure why is it mentioned as separate bullet.  Reference from zendesk ticket on what customer said(attached):

i _think_ the intention is that `integration function` is a possible component of both upstream integrations and downstream integrations

since there are options for upstream integrations and downstream integrations that don't use custom functions at all
• drive/mailbox upstream integrations
• email/drive downstream integrations
but i agree that `integration function` as a separate bullet is confusing -> maybe there's another way to structure this bulleted list? @melissa.amos

@vp I'll reconsider the glossary explanations in light of this feedback. But just curious, is Arondor using the glossary as their source of truth? Hopefully they know there are actual docs about integrations? https://docs.instabase.com/automate/deployments#configuring-integrations
